title: Compiler error when introducing a 'final' field
description: When introducing a 'final' field, a compiler error occurs with no source information available.
OB: The aspect below fails to compile with 1.1b2, producing the compilation error: $ ajc com/ibm/amc/.java com/ibm/amc/ejb/.java d:/eclipse/runtime/workspace/ajsamples/Mock EJBs/com/ibm/amc/DemoBeanEJB.java:1: Cannot assign a value to the final field com.ibm.amc.DemoBean.ajc$interField$comibmamc$verbose!!
EB: To enable and disable the creation of type comments, go to Window > Preferences > Java > Code Generation.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the 'DemoBeanEJB.java' file located at 'd:/eclipse/runtime/workspace/ajsamples/Mock EJBs/com/ibm/amc/'.
2. Introduce a 'final' field in the 'DemoBeanEJB' aspect.
3. Attempt to compile the code using version 1.1b2 of the AspectJ Compiler (ajc).
4. Observe the compiler error mentioned in the observed behavior.
